# Kyla McConnell

Ph.D. student in Linguistics at the University of Freiburg's [English Department](https://www.anglistik.uni-freiburg.de) doing quantitative psycholinguistic research on [individual differences in language processing](http://www.hpsl-linguistics.org/index.php?id=162&projekt=355) under the guidance and support of [Alice Blumenthal-Dram√©](https://www.anglistik.uni-freiburg.de/seminar/mitarbeiter-und-sprechstunden/blumenthal).

Interests: Statistical data analysis with R, data science with Python, open & reproducible science

Member of the [Hermann Paul School of Linguistics](http://www.hpsl-linguistics.org).

Read more about my work: ["Effects of task and corpus-derived association scores on the online processing of collocations"](https://www.degruyter.com/view/j/cllt.ahead-of-print/cllt-2018-0030/cllt-2018-0030.xml)

Also in Freiburg? Stop by our [Statistics Study Group for Linguists](http://www.hpsl-linguistics.org/index.php?id=1580)!
